title: Executive Order 5541-Power-Site Restoration No. 458, John Day River, Oregon
content: So much of the orders of June 26, 1909, creating Temporary Power-Site Withdrawal No. 24, and July 2, 1910, creating Power-Site Reserve No. 24, as affects the lands hereinafter described, is hereby revoked:
Willamette Meridian
T. 8 S., R. 19 E., sec. 26, W. ½ NE. ¼.
T. 9 S., R. 22 E., sec. 14, NW. ¼ SE. ¼;
sec. 22, SW. ¼ NE. ¼.
T. 9 S., R. 23 E., sec. 1, S. ½ SW. ¼;
sec. 2, SE. ¼ SE. ¼;
sec. 8, SE. ¼ NE. ¼; S. ½ SE. ¼;
sec. 9, NW. ¼ NE. ¼;
sec. 10, N. ½ NE. ¼, NE. ¼ NW. ¼;
sec. 11, NW. ¼ NW. ¼;
sec. 12, NE. ¼ NE. ¼.

So much of the orders of November 17, 1909, creating Temporary Power-Site Withdrawal No. 65, and July 2, 1910, creating Power-Site Reserve No. 65, as affects the lands hereinafter described, is hereby revoked:

sec. 18, SE. ¼ NE. ¼
T. 13 S., R. 26 E., sec. 25, E. ½ NE. ¼, NE. ¼ SE. ¼.

So much of the orders of May 19, 1910, creating Temporary Power-Site Withdrawal No. 145, and July 2, 1910, creating Power-Site Reserve No. 145, as affects the lands hereinafter described, is hereby revoked:

T. 9 S., R. 23 E., sec. 2, SW. ¼ SE. ¼;
sec. 17, SW. ¼ NW. ¼;
sec. 18, SE. ¼ NE. ¼.
T. 9 S., R. 25 E., sec. 23, SW. ¼ NE. ¼, NE. ¼ NW. ¼.
HERBERT HOOVER
The White House,January 27, 1931.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5541-Power-Site Restoration No. 458, John Day River, Oregon Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/361769
